list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I wish to show my appreciation for everything which you have done.

list_definition.definition: the state of valuing or understanding something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has gained a deep appreciation of poetry.

list_definition.definition: the state of being aware of something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has no appreciation of our difficulties.

list_definition.definition: a written article etc which describes the qualities of something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Sheila is writing an appreciation of the new book.

list_ex_of_english: Appreciations of this kind are confidential.
They develop an appreciation for the beauty and elegance of the body.
Future progress depended crucially on a proper appreciation of the past.
The more staff officers we have, the more appreciations and minutes are written, the more confusing it then is when one have to make a decision about what to do.
To do this, consider an alternative which involves the most enjoyable form of appreciation one can think of for some finite duration of time.
We also increased our appreciation of the current state of theory development.
They are views genuinely held having regard to people's individual appreciations of these very difficult problems.
In the event of significant amounts of foreign exchange obligations being incurred and of large appreciations in the currencies, the liabilities outside the limits could become large.
